claim_data.description:
To whom it may concern,

I am submitting this claim regarding a flight I was unable to board on December 14, 2024, due to an unforeseen medical emergency. I experienced acute abdominal pain the night before the flight and was admitted to Pacific Grove Medical Center in Los Angeles.

I have attached the official hospital admission and discharge documentation. I was advised not to travel for at least 48 hours following the treatment.

The flight in question was booked through my employer’s travel portal.

I kindly request reimbursement or rescheduling of this ticket in accordance with my insurance policy’s coverage for medical emergencies.

Sincerely,
Naomi Feldman

llm_decision.explanation: The provided medical documentation is in .md (markdown) format, which is a text-based file. According to the policy, medical certificates MUST be image files (jpg, jpeg, png, webp, etc.). This violates a critical document validation rule and is a Priority 1 fraud indicator. Therefore, the claim is denied.
fraud_indicators: Medical documentation provided as .md file instead of image file
reasoning_steps: Checked the file type of the medical documentation.
Identified that the medical documentation is in .md format.
Verified that .md format is not an acceptable format according to the policy.
Determined that this is a Priority 1 fraud indicator.
Made the decision to DENY the claim based on the unacceptable file format.
